description: Italian cycling game that was released by a small publisher from Milan in the 1940's. Although the game mechanics are very straightforward, the game board features very nice graphics, especially considering the age of the game.

Each player has one cyclist. At each turn the player rolls the dice and move his or her cyclist. The board has 63 squares, the kilometer-mark squares double your throw. The game is like The Game of Goose. The first player who lands exactly on space 63 wins the game.

Games Research/Design (GR/D) returns Europa to its roots and revisits the best selling Europa title Fire in the East. The new game covers the same time period as the older ones (summer of 1941 to the spring of 1942) but uses a completely new Soviet OB, a new map, and the latest rules for the Europa system.

Total War gives the Axis player the opportunity to see if he can improve on the massive offensive that pocketed and captured millions of Soviet soldiers. Can you take Moscow or Leningrad? Or are you condemned to suffer the Soviet winter short of victory? The Soviet player must build a strategic reserve large enough to stop the advancing Axis forces and throw them out of Russia. The Soviet player is aided by massive reinforcements that allow him to form new defensive lines in an attempt to slow down or stop the Axis armor thrusts.

Total War is a historical game on the German invasion of the Soviet Union, from summer 1941 to spring 1942. It charts the titanic struggle of the largest ground campaign in World War II, from the Axis offensives that brought the Germans to the gates of Moscow to the Soviet winter counteroffensive that hurled them back.

Total War is a two-player game. One side controls the forces of Germany and its allies while the other controls the forces of the Soviet Union. The maps cover Eastern Europe and the western USSR from the Arctic Ocean to the Black Sea, from the plains of Poland to the steppes along the Volga River. Ground units represent corps, divisions, brigades, regiments, and battalions. Air units represent groups of 40 to 120 aircraft. Naval units represent task forces of warships.

Total War is a complete remake and updating of the classic Europa game, Fire in the East. The game’s Soviet order of battle makes extensive use of formerly secret Kremlin information on the Red Army forces that fought the war. The game includes a Soviet order of battle for all of the USSR from 1939 to 1942 and is the more comprehensive game OB ever published on the Red Army in peace and war. The Axis order of battle also is updated, reflecting new research since the publication of Fire in the East. The rules for Total War incorporate the latest rules for the Europa system, with on-demand air power, armor effects, combined arms, and much more, recreating both the German blitzkrieg that captured entire Soviet armies and the Soviet deep operations that nearly splintered the invaders in the depth of the Russian winter.

(from Games Research/Design (GR/D) web site:)


The box, counters and maps were printed and sold without complete rules.
Educational card game by Nathan about painters. The game contains 48 cards with lots of info about paintings and painters on it.

Zambezy ... a board game of strategic placement and points accumulation using luck of the draw and tactics.

The object is to accumulate points by placing or exposing pieces of the same colour on four adjacent spaces to form squares.

Pieces may be placed on top of others but only on opposing-colour pieces - maximum: 4 high.

Only same-colour pieces on the top tier of any 4 adjacent spaces forming a square score points.

There are 3 different colour exception pieces ... that may help or hinder!

Players only win points with their own colour pieces - even when one is placed by the opponent completing their square(s).

The player with the most points wins.

Contents
milled beech wood playing board (24cm x 38cm) with burnt in (branded) playing surface
71 custom-made plastic playing pieces: 1 clear + 1 green + 3 orange + 33 blue + 33 red
felt base
cloth bag

Quel est ce bruit? (What is this noise?) is an educational game for learning French (intended for those whose native language is French).  It consists of 6 boards of various scenes (e.g. camping scene).  Using a cassette tape, you would play sounds/words and place disks as you identified these.

A long time ago Gods were disputing who would rule the world. Horus would claim power on Egypt and Seth on the desert. Seth wasn't content with this and would soon take revenge. This game is based upon a comic book and cartoon of Papyrus. It's aimed at children starting from age 6.

Each player begins with a hand of five cards. The cards have either a number (from 2-8- some of which also have special powers) or a picture of Kong. In each round of the battle, players simultaneously selects a card and places it face down in front of him. The cards are then revealed and, in general, the card with the higher number wins the round (with some exceptions due to Kong cards and special powers.)
The winner of the round either moves the Kong figure to the first space on his side of the board if he did not win the last round or advances Kong a space if he won the last round. The loser gets to draw a card. In the case of a tie, both players draw two cards.
A player must win three rounds [b]in a row[/b] in order to win the game. If the deck is exhausted before someone has won 3 in a row, the player who has won the most rounds (tallied by keeping the cards from won battles in front of him) wins. A player can also lose by running out of cards.

The historic 'Dallas Cowboys and the world’s most popular board game have teamed up to create the ultimate fantasy for fans of all ages. This incredible NFL franchise has won a phenomenal five Super Bowls and its roster includes some of the greatest gridiron players of all time. Buy, sell and trade the most significant players, coaches and historic moments in the history of the Cowboys, including Michael Irvin, Randy White, Bob Lilly and Tom Landry. Get ready to wheel and deal your way to the ultimate Cowboys team of all time!

Comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens: Cowboys Cheerleader,  Football, Referee’s Whistle, Quarterback, Cowboys Helmet and Linebacker.

Dimensions: 26 × 51 × 4 cm
Ages: 8+
Players: 2-6

Minus 13 is easiest described as a multi-player shut the box.  Players take turns rolling 3 dice and removing colored chips from hexagonal pyramid that is made from six triangular parts.  The players total up the numbers on the dice and remove the colored chip that sits on the corresponding number.  If there is no chip left on that number then the player takes any number of chips from numbers that add up to the total of the roll.  When a 13 is rolled the player must take chip that sits on top of the pyramid that is worth negative 13 points.  If a player is unable to take chips that add up to his or her number (ie. another 13 is rolled) then they must pass one of their colored chips to the person on their left.  In this way the "minus 13" chip can be passed on.

At the end of the game, each player rolls dice to determine how many points each colored chip is worth.  The player holding the "minus 13" chip subtracts the appropriate amount of points and the person with the most points wins.

Spanish cycling game based on the Tour de France. The game uses dice but also some cards that are used for a sprint, there also is a flat tire card. The game also includes a double sided board with different stages, it even includes some roadsigns.

The Ardennes Offensive, officially named the Battle of the Ardennes by the U.S. Army (and known to the general public as the Battle of the Bulge), started on December 16, 1944. The goal of these operations as planned by the Germans was to split the British and American Allied line in half, capturing Antwerp and then proceeding to encircle and destroy four Allied armies, forcing the Western Allies to negotiate a peace treaty in the Axis' favor.

This NAC game represents the important battle of WWII.

Take turns placing your disc on Tony's tail.  When you flick the tail, the disc flies onto his back and lands in one of the holes.  The first player to get three in a row wins.

For ages 3-7.

This is a short dexterity game, played with a half-globe and six different pieces (cubes and cylinders) in six different colors. The game is about building a tower from the colored pieces on top of the half globe, which forms a wobbly surface.

Each turn, a player rolls the die to see which piece he has to stack onto the tower. The player who makes the tower collapse, loses the game.

Adventures in the Dungeon is a small Dungeon-Crawler originally published within "The Official Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Coloring Album."  The game's rules are cleverly placed at the bottom of each page, and are complimented by a map of the Dungeon in the center of the book.

The game is designed for 1-4 players, who will assume the role of characters seeking The Holy Talisman of St. Cuthbert.  The 4 characters (Paladin, Rangeress, Fighter, Wizard) each have different abilities.

To find the Talisman, players must wander the Dungeon and face the creatures therein.  Combat is simulated with 2D6, and the players roll attacks for both themselves and their monstrous opponents.  The various monsters have special abilities, and the characters will need to coordinate their efforts carefully to make it through.

Players win the Quest by finding the Talisman, and a scoring system is included based on how many monsters were slain, and how many characters survive.

This is a party game where the players are telling a story and adding 'mystery' words.  It is, according to the directions, "A Laughable Round Party Game".  It contains instructions and about 100 cards used during the storytelling of the game.

Take a Number is a game by Stephen Sniderman created for Kadon Games' 25th anniversary. It is actually 25 games in one, each nicely outlined in a thick rulebook. The rulebook also includes multiple solitaire games and math puzzles. This game is available on its own or is playable with Kadon's Six-by-Six game set.

First printed in 1996, in the years since Grunt has sold thousands and thousands of copies over four print versions (Original 1st edition, 2nd Edition, 2nd Edition: Deluxe and 2nd Edition: Deluxe 2 player Box Set). Now newly updated to Grunt 3rd Edition, this revised edition of Grunt has brought the game system back to its roots, a fast paced, easy to learn all purpose fantasy miniatures system thats extremely affordable.

Grunt is a unique miniatures system that focusses on army development, where you may recruit new units through the course of game play, plus have existing units gain experience points and levels. With expansion sets you can expand your army building options to include skills, abilities, expand your kingdom, customize your castles, add wizardry, monsters, magical items, develop heroes and immortals and more.


In this fashion, you strive to build up your army and kingdom over multiple battles (game sessions). You must weigh the costs to your army to achieve victory in your battle today against the gains victory can gain for your army for the long haul. 
Grunt 3rd Edition is a complete miniatures game system, including game rules, 45 Battle Cards, a castle template, city template, assorted cut-out Battlefield Markers, plus cut-out army units enough to field two complete armies. And, of course, you can always print out more as needed!.

Includes:
Cover + 38 pages
- Game Rules
- 45 Battle Cards
- Castle Template
- City template
- 2 Cut-Out Armies
- Assorted Battlefield Markers that include Supply, Traps, Cavalry, Fortifications, Fortresses, Scaling Ropes, Ballisti, Siege Towers, Castle Defenses, and Catapults.

Make your way around the chosen race route and be the first player to reach the checkered flag. Watch your fuel, beware of nasty weather conditions, manage pitstops, and avoid detours in your pursuit of glory.

This game is based on the real-life outdoor sport of letterboxing.

Players hide "letterboxes" somewhere on the board and write clues for the other players. Everyone then attempts to find as many letterboxes as possible. A player gains victory points both when she finds other letterboxes and when other players find hers.

The game ends when one player has found all other letterboxes. The player with the most victory points is then the winner.

This game won the first Mesomorph Games Piecepack Competition in 2006, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the four seasons expansion.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

From The Rule Book:

"Welcome to the exciting and thrilling world of MotoGP racing.
Start enjoying right now the magic, the strategy and the tactics – just like your idols do – of competing in appealing circuits such as TT Assen, emblematic ones such as the Circuit de Catalunya and fast ones such as Donington Park.
Compete with a total of 11 teams and 19 drivers from 8 countries.
Compete with 5 world class manufacturers who will use their best efforts and technology to help you win.
The ultimate goal of this game is naturally to win individual races if you play in Single Race mode, or to win the MotoGP Championship if you play in Championship mode.
To do this, you will have to prove your strategy, your luck and your skill, until the checkered flag comes down and you’ve won – just like in real races.
Each race consists of a total of 3 laps. Depending on the number of players, this will take you between 1.5 and 2 hours."

Each game contains:

    19 Bikes in 8 two-driver teams and 3 single-driver teams
    3 Grandstands with spectators
    1 Pit building
    4 dice
    1 Pad of Sheets for recording race results.
    1 Pad of Sheets for recording championship placings.
    6 Boards of the following tracks:
           Circuit de Catalunya (Spain)
           TT Assen (Netherlands)
           Mugello (Italy)
           Donington Park (Great Britain)
           Le Mans (France)
           Twin Ring Motegui (Japan)
    
    1 Instruction book


Home Page: http://gamesfortableraces.com/       >>> edit: 2013 Novemver 18th - web site is not in use anymore <<<

From the publisher's catalog: "Once again the German pocket-battleship is loose in the South Atlantic and the British player faces the challenge of finding and bringing her to battle. Graf Spee comes complete with die-cut counters, rules booklet, battle board and two movement boards."

Another entry in the long line of AH Bismarck-style search and battle naval wargames, this one is very rare. As the name implies, it covers the search for the German "pocket battleship" Graf Spee in 1939.

With the usual low-quality Third Millenia components (especially the counters) and very simple rules, it is nevertheless a pretty fun game.

Like AH Bismarck, Midway, et al, movement and search are conducted on the two identical map sheets, and battles are resolved on the battle and charts sheet. Turn order is:
a. German player rolls for bad weather (no searches). German player moves.
b. British player searches.
c. British player moves.
d. German player searches.
e. If both in same hex, resolve battle.
f. When all battles are resolved, advance the turn record and start over.

The British can search the hexes ships are in, and one more hex within four hexes (search aircraft). Aircraft carriers (4 British and 1 French) can search the six adjacent hexes. The German player can search the hexes ships are in, plus the Graf Spee has two search aircraft that can search within four hexes. The German player can also search any other three hexes on the board (u-boat reports?).

Both players must keep track of fuel expenditures, and both have supply ships available to re-fuel (or they can re-fuel in ports). Every other turn the German player can roll on a table to sink one (or two) merchantmen. If he sinks any, he then rolls on another table to see how many turns later he must inform the British player in which hex the sinking occurred. The German player must sink a number of merchant ships and escape the map to win; otherwise the British player wins.

No indication is given of map or time scale. I suspect search board turns are one day. 20 turns to a game.

Components: two identical 14" x 24" hex-gridded search map sheets, one 14" x 24" battle and chart sheet, one rule folder (five small pages), plus 119 of 1/2-inch die-cut unit counters. 
I think there were 24 actual ship counters, some "?" s and "search" counters, and a bunch of blanks (my copy is unfortunately incomplete).

Self-published Heroquest-like game.

This whole game is being redesigned from the ground up (2015).
It's learning fun the Golden way as children match color dominoes along a spiraling color path.  Color recognition and matching skills are reinforced.  For ages 3 and up.

Tactic Blue is a compilation of 6 abstract games by 3 different authors.  All of the games are played on a two-sided board, using the hex-grid or square-grid side.


     Accasta
     Abande
     Attangle
     Attraktion
     Alva
     International Checkers


Accasta, Abande, Attangle are games designed by Dieter Stein and are part of his stacking games trilogy. Attraktion, a game by Jaroslav Cichocki, uses pull force (attraction) in movement to form a winning condition.  Alva, designed by Alvydas Jakeliunas, is like a souped-up version of checkers.  The last game included is a classic International Checkers.  Apparently the gameboard and components happened to be compatible.  Some of the games were previously published on websites.

From the Three Monkey Games website:www.monkeypoker1.com

Once again, the geniuses at Three Monkey Games have turned a classic game on its ear and came up with something BRAND NEW! Introducing MonkeyWinks! The popular indoor game that is easy to learn for kids, and formidable enough to appeal to adults wanting a special challenge.

Like its predecessor, MonkeyWinks is a game played with sets of small, thin discs (called winks) lying on a special felt mat. Players use a larger disc (called a squidger) to pop a smaller disc into flight by pressing down on one side of the smaller disc. The basic goal of an informal game (easily playable by young children) is to cause the smaller discs to land inside a pot or cup. The formal game has a more robust set of rules, goals, and strategies suitable to serious competition for adults and older children.

MonkeyWinks is interactive fun for all players, pros and beginners alike. However, MonkeyWinks is a lot more than just a flipping disc game. For example, the included "Go Bananas"™ cards incorporate random events and player changes inspired by everyday kids games. 
www.monkeypoker1.com

From the website of the publisher:

Oh clever goblins, will you be able to avoid the wrath of the Dark Lord (Rigor Mortis, the Master of all Evils) while he wanders in his study? Terrible spells will be cast upon those who are hit by the glances of the Dark Lord!

Kragmortha is a party game for 2-8 players that will be afflicted by exhilarating penances. No one will resist its humor!

BEWARE! This game produces physical penances and is nocive (definition of nocive is : Hurtful or injurious) to the health!

Kragmortha shares artwork with Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box

Children's version of the Zobmondo!! games (ages 7 and up). On your turn, you roll a die and move your pawn that many spaces. Pick up a "Would You Rather" card and select which of the two choices you would rather do (such as "Would you rather: 1) Run across a hungry alligator's back; or 2) Run under an angry elephant?"). Your opponents decide which they'd think you'd do as well, and record it by putting a token under their palm with either the "Choice 1" or "Choice 2" side facing up. Then you announce your choice, explain your choice, and try to guess which choice your opponents thought that you would make. Each time you guess correctly, you move your pawn one space on the board. The game ends when someone crosses the finish line.

" A game based on the ballad by Theodor Fontane. The garden is set up and the pears are distributed, depending on the number of players pears are put onto the tree, always at one side, or a player hands on pears to be put up. Pears must be taken with one hand and always from the same side, and be put onto a branch of the three. Depending on the variant, one harvests pears that fall from the unused side, and may keep them or give them away. The player with the most valuable pears after a preset number of rounds wins the game. Ballad printed in the rules.

Dexterity and tactical game * 2 or more players * no age given * Designer: Reinhold Wittig * Graphics: Karin und Reinhold Wittig * Edition Perlhuhn, Germany, 2005 *** Edition Perlhuhn * www.perlhuhn.de "

From www.spielen.at 2006/11/31

ElectraWoman & DynaGirl must reach the Secret Scientific Formula space in their ElectraCar and return to ElectraBase while using different combinations of Computer Power symbol cards to thwart the bad guys:  The Sorcerer, The Pharaoh, The Empress of Evil, The Spider Lady, Glitter Rock, and Ali Baba.

Each Trouble Space depicts a different combination of Computer Power symbols needed in order to overcome it.  Computer Powers include ElectraData, ElectraForce, ElectraBeam, and a few Super Power cards (a combination of all three).  If a player does not have the right combination of Computer Powers for that particular Trouble Space, they must remain in it until the correct combination is achieved.  A card is drawn every turn, regardless of whether a player can move.

Additional cards used to obstruct opposing players include ElectraPush and ElectraComp Blocked.

This game is based on the short-lived Sid and Marty Krofft live action children’s television series from 1976, starring Deidre Hall in her first major television role as ElectraWoman and Judy Strangis as DynaGirl.

April 1863
Union General Ulysses S. Grant embarks on another attempt to wrest control of the last major Confederate stronghold on the Mississippi River from the rebels; the fortress city of Vicksburg. Numerous other attempts have failed miserably. The ill-fated campaign from the north, short circuited by that devil Forrest's raid on Grant's supply lines. The jinxed canal, dug through the swamps in an attempt to bypass the city's guns. Now another plan is in motion. Grant will march his Army of the Tennessee through the Louisiana swamps, sneak his ships past the rebel fortress in a daring run of the gauntlet, conduct the largest amphibious invasion in U.S. history, separate himself from his supply base, wedge himself in between two rebel armies, and seize control of the city from the east! All the while battling politicians and public opinion as much as the Confederate armies. Somehow, his daring plan worked, and the Mississippi once again flowed unvexed to the sea.

But things could have been different. Find out how....

This operational level game uses the block unit system to re-create the limited intelligence of the actual campaign. Players maneuver their forces without adequate knowledge of their opponents strengths or even location. The game board spans the campaign topography, from the swamps of eastern Louisiana to the mountainous terrain around Jackson Mississippi. A point to point movement system is employed on a 20 x 24 playing map. Limited command abilities and critical supply wagons are key to managing your armies and achieving victory.
Card driven movement game for children. Based on the "Peepul Pals" line of books and dolls published by Whitman in the 1960's
Spin and move children's game.  Featuring the cats Jean-Tom and Mewsette traveling through Paris.
Spin and Move boat racing game.

Spin and move children's game.  Based on the TV show Bozo the Clown.  The board shows Bozo in the Circus,under the big top.

Climb the ladder, go across the high wire, if you fall there is a safety net, as you race to the finish line.
Spin and Move Children's game.  Game Board featuring the animated characters of Yogi Bear, Boo-Boo Bear, Mr. Ranger, Quickdraw McGraw, Huckleberry Hound and others Flying kites.

Players in Escalation! want to collect as few cards as possible. Each player starts with a hand of six cards from a deck that contains cards numbered 1-13, three jokers that can be worth 1-7, and two "pass" cards. One player opens by playing a single card or multiple cards with the same value, then calls out the sum of the cards played. The next player — and each player after that — must play cards to surpass that sum or else collect all of the cards played so far, after which they open with one or more cards. As soon as one player is out of cards, everyone else adds their cards in hand to the cards that they've collected and tallies their score.

After playing as many rounds as the number of players at the table, whoever has the lowest score wins!
Deduction game based on the ABC TV show "The Detectives" starring Robert Taylor.  Players race around the board collecting clue's.  A spinner determines the location of the various clues.

In Hand 2 Hand, players take turns drawing various things while other players attempt to guess what's being drawn.  Points are scored for correct guesses.

The trick is that partners must use the "double-handed drawing arm", working together to properly draw each subject.

Wormhole by Worldworks Games is a tabletop space combat game which promises an affordable yet paradigm shifting gaming experience. Taking the "virtual board game" concept to the bleeding edge; instead of forcing overpriced lead miniatures on players Wormhole offers a complete fleet of high quality 3-D models that you print and build from your home printer. This feature alone gives players the opportunity to build massive fleets without breaking the bank.

Wormhole promises "cinematic" space combat with visual style and presentation not yet seen in the genre. Rules are easy to understand but offer a scaling level of depth for a variety of play styles. Wormhole also introduces an interactive damage and orders system which removes heavy book-keeping tasks and replaces it with a "control panel-like" interface (you feel absolutely in control, barking orders to your fleet). A number of unique gaming elements conspire to make Wormhole a truly immersive and completely original gaming experience.

Home Page: http://www.worldworksgames.com/wormhole.html
This is a memory game where each player is trying to find and build the alphabet made of puzzle pieces of their chosen color.
Board game based on Horse Show Jumping. The game has four plastic horses with riders, a variety of fences, walls and other items to make up the Show Jumping course on the board.

Imperial Commander is a set of Tactical level miniature wargame rules for Science-Fiction combat.  It was based around the Tabletop Figures range of 15mm Sci-Fi figures and was designed to give a fast game when using around 50 figures per side.
The rules cover light infantry through to power armor, force shields and vehicles.  They also contain some army lists and conversions from Laserburn and Combat 3000.

A game very much in the vein of Trivial Pursuit. Semantic requires players to answer questions based on the meaning of words. Players must complete a path around the board answering questions as they go. Movement is based on a dice roll.

This game from the Wing National Game Company of St. Augustine, FLA was indeed copyrighted in 1898.

[The box says this game was published by Parker Brothers.]

The game consists of a Battle Ground with 31 Navy Paths (31 circles) each of which are intersected at 5 or 6 places by other paths. These intersections are called fighting positions.  Red, White and Blue designs across the battleground are called Line of Shot.

The game comes with 9 white and 9 black washers that represent Battleships from two Navies.

Each navy changes form (moves) in turn. Only one move is allowed at a time. The sinking of an opponents ship occurs when you manage to get two of your ships on the same line of shot as that of an enemy ship, with your nearest ship half way between the enemy and your back ship. When the range is so short that your two ships and the enemy lay in 3 consecutive positions then the enemy is captured and not sunk. When that happens you may remove the captured ship and place any of your ships in one of the starting positions. This allows you to fix placement errors by returning your ship to the start.

It´s a little like the German game "Mau Maus" resp. "UNO".
There are four colors with 18 cards, of 5 types including the law cards. Also there jokers.
You start the game with 12 coins and every round with 6 hand cards. The game ends when one player has no more money left at the end of a round. The player with the most money wins.
On your turn you place a card on the discard pile. It has to match the color or the type of the last card. If you can´t place a card you have to draw a new one. If you can´t place it either your turn ends.
The round ends when one player has no more cards. Leftover cards cost you money and round end law cards are applied.
The law-cards help you or force other players to do silly things every turn or get a disadvantage during the round or at the end of it.
Some of the cards have instant effects on them.

box-inventory
82 cards
60 coins (gold and silver)
rules

A tactical dice-game for Hannover's places of interest, from Bothfield to Kirchrode.
"People Nature Technology" was the motto of the 2000 Hannover expo.


Ein taktisches Würfelspiel zu Hannoverschen Sehenswürdigkeiten von Bothfeld bis Kirchrode.
"Mensch Natur Technik" war das Motto der Expo 2000 in Hannover.

Be the king of Pot, Hash and 'Shrooms.  You roll dice and progress around the board.  In the process you 'make connections' wherein you can buy and sell illegal commodities. 
The Market Level for commodity prices will vary as the game goes on.  Be the first to accumulate $20,000 and you win!

The Bee Safe or Be Sorry Game helps kids be aware of dangers. It features "Stinger" and "Buzzie".

The age recommendation is 4 and up.

The players are represented by playing pieces which are shapes, a square, a circle, a triangle, and a rectangle.  There are Honeycomb cards, Stinging Bee cards, Safety First cards, Buzzie Bee cards, Safehouse cards, Stranger Cards, and a spinner.

Players start with three Honeycomb cards and move about the board drawing the other cards.  The other cards have situations on them that are to be read and then directions to either move (forwards or backwards) and/or draw/lose Honeycomb cards.  The situations all have to do with safety.

Th winner is the first to reach the hive first or obtain 15 Honeycomb cards!

This game is a very simple and typical roll and move game, where players try to go from the beginning to the track which has 100 positions. In places where there's a red position instead of a yellow, players encounter different kinds of problems which may affect who's the winner.

Paletti game no. 2893

Kick-o-Mania is a dexterity soccer/football game played on a large 4x7 foot playing field.  The figures are fully positionable and controlled by your actions.

Rules and a full range of figures and game accessories are available in stores or through the website http://www.kick-o-mania.com
